{{merge|Game drop|Named update|discussAnchor=Merge with Game drop into Named update|discussPage=Talk:Major update}}
{{About|the annual content updates to the game|relatively smaller more frequent named updates|Game drop}}
A '''major update''' is a type of [[update]] that adds a large number of features.
[[File:Packed.jpeg|thumb|Screenshot containing features from [[Tricky Trials]], an example of a major update.]]

== Description ==
Major updates are loosely planned up to two years in advance at the earliest, give or take, depending on community feedback.<ref> https://youtu.be/2cxUNoWNy50?t=9827</ref> While the game is currently using the [[game drop]] release formula, there is no limit to how large a game drop can be. Therefore, it would be possible for Mojang to occasionally release larger game drops, which could then be considered major updates.<ref>https://youtu.be/2cxUNoWNy50?t=12010</ref>{{dubious|Needs a reliable transcript and translation of both segments, plus the part where Ulraf specifies whether his statement is factual or an opinion.}}

Typically, these include new [[biome]]s or [[structure]]s as the highlights, and most of the features fit into an overarching theme as described by the update's name. For example, [[Tricky Trials]] adds a single new structure, and almost every new feature in the update is directly related to the [[trial chambers]] or is an actual part of them.

=== ''Bedrock Edition'' ===
{{BE}} was formerly known as {{PE}} and {{Edition|Windows 10}}. In the [[Better Together Update]], those editions were combined into {{BE|nl=1}}.
* {{PE|nl=1}} and {{Edition|Windows 10|nl=1}} were replaced with {{BE|nl=1}} through a software update. This means they were mostly the same game, just under different names.
* {{LCE|nl=1}} however uses completely different software and has its own [[Legacy Console Edition version history|version history]] and [[#Legacy Console Edition|updates]].
* {{Edition|edu|nl=1}} uses the same codebase as {{BE|nl=1}}, but has extra features. Therefore, it also has its own [[Minecraft Education version history|version history]] and extra [[#Minecraft Education|updates]].

This section lists named updates for {{PE|nl=1}} and {{Edition|Windows 10|nl=1}} only.

===Synced updates===
Ever since the [[Update Aquatic]], ''Java Edition'' and ''Bedrock Edition'' have shared all of their major updates. This means each major update since Update Aquatic has been available on both ''Java Edition'' and ''Bedrock Edition'', and newer updates are usually released to all editions and platforms at around the same time.
